alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Garland (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 5:28PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garland and east central Montgomery Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 528 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Meyers, or 15 miles southeast of Mount Ida, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Mountain Pine... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Meyers... Lake Ouachita State Park... Lofton... Rockwell... Hot Springs National Park... Sunshine... Royal... Pettyview... Hempwallace... Pearcy... Crystal Springs... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, western and southwestern Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Garland
